First, we need to determine the current populations of both regions. According to the World Bank, the population of the Balkans (Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Greece, Kosovo, North Macedonia, Montenegro, Romania, Serbia, and Slovenia) as of 2020 is approximately 56 million. On the other hand, the population of Japan as of 2020 is approximately 126 million, according to the same source. 
So, comparing these two figures we can see that the population of the Balkans is significantly smaller than that of Japan. Therefore, the correct answer to the question is (B) no.
